regexp
Class Fragment

java.lang.Object
  regexp.Fragment

public class Fragment
extends java.lang.Object

The Fragment class specifies the Fragment object, that is used in the generation of an NFA. The Fragment is a partial NFA, and by patching these Fragments together the algorithm specified in the NFA-class generates the automata. The Fragment keeps track of the starting state of the partial automata, as well as the states with "dangling arrows", that is, state transitions that do not point to anything yet.

Constructor Summary
Fragment()
          Initializes a new instance of Fragment with no starting state and no outwards pointing arrows, creating in essence an empty fragment.
Fragment(State start, OwnArrayList outArrows)
          Initializes a new instance of Fragment, with starting state and a number of outwards-pointing states, contained in an instance of OwnArrayList.
Fragment(State start, State out)
          Initializes a new instance of Fragment, with starting state and one outwards-pointing state.
